content.title: Minimata Mahtari Jatan Yojana
content.details: The Labor Department of Chhattisgarh introduced the 'Minimata Mahtari Jatan Yojana' on March 4, 2010, through the 'Building and Construction Workers Welfare Board.' This initiative is designed to provide benefits to registered female construction workers during pregnancy. The scheme applies to both male and female beneficiaries who are registered and possess a beneficiary identity card at least 90 days before the scheme application date. Note: The name of this scheme was changed from 'Bhagini Prasuti Sahayata Yojana' to 'Minimata Mahtari Jatan Yojana' on May 12, 2022.
benefits: A lump sum amount of ₹20,000/- will be provided to the registered female construction worker after the birth of the child.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Chhattisgarh.
The applicant should be a woman worker.
The applicant should be registered with the Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The benefit will only be provided for the first two children.
The applicant should be registered as a construction worker 90 days in advance.
exclusions: Spouses of construction workers employed by public or government institutions.
Construction worker beneficiaries who lack valid membership with the Board.
documents_required: Certificate issued by self or Maternal and Child Card issued by ANM
Self-declaration certificate in the prescribed form issued by the government in respect of the employer.

faqs.question: What is this scheme?
faqs.answer: The 'Building and Construction Workers Welfare Board' of the Chhattisgarh Government provided financial assistance to women construction workers on March 4, 2010.

faqs.question: What are the benefits?
faqs.answer: A lump sum assistance amount of ₹ 20,000/- will be given to the eligible beneficiaries.

faqs.question: Who can get the benefits?
faqs.answer: All registered construction worker individuals from Chhattisgarh State.

faqs.question: What is the official website to apply for the scheme?
Is this scheme for women?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is for Registered female construction workers.

faqs.question: How late can an applicant apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicant can apply up to 90 days after the birth of the child.

faqs.question: For how many children can the applicant avail the benefit of this scheme?
How will the beneficiary get the benefit?
faqs.answer: Beneficiary will get the benefit through the RTGS/NEFT in her bank account.

faqs.question: Who will get the benefit if a woman dies during childbirth?
faqs.answer: Benefits will be provided to her husband.

faqs.question: How does one apply for assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible mothers can apply for assistance under this scheme through online portals.
